newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Oct 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business - Oct 18.

text.p: The New York Times reported the following business stories on Friday:
- Two senior executives at Archer Daniels Midland Co have resigned as a federal investigation into price fixing at the company deepens.
- U.S. indicators on industrial production, housing starts and employement sparked a bond market rally and helped pull stock prices higher.
- AT&T Corp reported a third-quarter profit from continuing operations of $1.36 billion or $0.84 per share.
- Nearly nine out of 10 senior company executives believe the U.S. economy is going well, according to a poll conducted by The New York Times and CBS News.
- Silicon Graphics Inc reported a first-quarter loss due to special charges and product transition issues.
- Only 10 percent of the corporate executives at the 500 biggest companies in the United States are women, according to the results of a census.
- British media conglomerate Pearson PLC named Marjorie Scardino as its chief executive. Scardino was chief executive of the Economist Group, which publishes the magazine of the same name.
- California has reduced from 60 to 45 days the suspension ordered against Chrysler Corp regarding the shipment of care and trucks to the state.
- Wall Street reacted with displeasure towards the merger of Tenet Healthcare and OrNda Healthcrop.
